name: fustily
content:
fustily adverb
(OLD-FASHIONED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in an old-fashioned way: Even gifted actors find this wordy and fustily academic play difficult. Her makeover of the old man's fustily furnished home caused great delight among her friends.
More examplesFewer examplesAt the end of the show, the female lead is joined by a fustily dressed choir.She lay in her fustily feminine bedroom in her little house.In the hallway there's a fustily floral carpet and a smell of air freshener.

fustily adverb
(SMELL)
in a way that is not fresh and that smells unpleasant, especially because of being left slightly wet: I slowly turned over the fustily smelling pages in front of me. The room was cold and smelled fustily damp.
